question.questionA: Parasitic plants without leaves; flowers in dense clusters.
Stems stout, orange; glomerules 10-12 mm; stigma capitate.
question.questionB: Stems weak, red; glomerules 10 mm or less; stigma elongate.

question.questionA: Glomerules 5-6 mm; calyx lobes fleshy, keeled.
question.questionB: Glomerules 7-10 mm; calyx lobes membranous, acute or acuminate.

question.questionA: Flowers inconspicuous; corolla with five spreading lobes; styles two.
question.questionB: Flowers conspicuous, funnel-shaped; corolla not lobed, or lobes not spreading; style one.

question.questionA: Calyx encircled by two large leafy bracteoles.
question.questionB: Calyx not encircled by two large leafy bracteoles.

question.questionA: Climbing perennials; leaves cordate to sagittate, not fleshy; bracteoles longer than the calyx; flowers 35-70 mm across, white.
question.questionB: Trailing  perennials;  leaves  reniform,  fleshy;  bracteoles  shorter than calyx; flowers 40-50 mm across, pink.

question.questionA: Flowers at least partly blue or purple.
Corolla 1 cm across, deeply five-lobed, blue; pedicels shorter than the leaves.
question.questionB: Corolla 2-5 cm across, not deeply lobed, throat yellow, surrounded by white middle zone and wide blue or purple margin; pedicels longer than leaves.

question.questionA: Non-climbing plants; leaves linear or lanceolate.
question.questionB: Non-climbing plants; leaves linear or lanceolate.

question.questionA: Bushy perennial to 50 cm; leaves silvery, coated with many adpressed hairs; flowers pink or white.
question.questionB: Tufted  perennial   to  30  cm;  leaves green, not silvery, coated with spreading hairs; flowers pink.

question.questionA: Leaves sagittate; corolla and calyx glabrous; corolla with purple stripes on the outside.
question.questionB: Lower leaves triangular-cordate, upper leaves deeply divided; corolla and calyx hairy; corolla with dark pink throat.
